verses.verse: Thinkest <S%H2803><s%> thou this to be thy right <S%H4941><s%>, Or sayest <S%H559><s%> thou <S%H6664><s%>, My righteousness is more than God <S%H410><s%>'s,
That thou sayest <S%H559><s%>, What advantage <S%H5532><s%> will it be unto thee <S%H3276><s%>? And, What profit shall I have <S%H2403><s%>, more than if I had sinned?
I will answer <S%H7725><s%> thee <S%H7453><s%>, And thy companions with thee.
Look <S%H5027><s%> unto the heavens <S%H8064><s%>, and see <S%H7200><s%>; And behold <S%H7789><s%> the skies <S%H7834><s%>, which are higher than thou <S%H1361><s%>.
If thou hast sinned <S%H2398><s%>, what effectest <S%H6466><s%> thou against him <S%H6588><s%>? And if thy transgressions be multiplied <S%H7231><s%>, what doest thou unto him <S%H6213><s%>?
If thou be righteous <S%H6663><s%>, what givest <S%H5414><s%> thou him <S%H3947><s%>? Or what receiveth he of thy hand <S%H3027><s%>?
Thy wickedness <S%H7562><s%> may hurt a man <S%H376><s%> as thou art <S%H6666><s%>; And thy righteousness may profit a son <S%H1121><s%> of man <S%H120><s%>.
By reason of the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of oppressions <S%H6217><s%> they cry out <S%H7768><s%>; They cry <S%H2199><s%> for help by reason of the arm <S%H2220><s%> of the mighty <S%H7227><s%>.
But none saith <S%H559><s%>, Where is God <S%H433><s%> my Maker <S%H6213><s%>, Who giveth <S%H5414><s%> songs <S%H2158><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%>,
Who teacheth <S%H502><s%> us more than the beasts <S%H929><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>, And maketh us wiser <S%H2449><s%> than the birds <S%H5775><s%> of the heavens <S%H8064><s%>?
There they cry <S%H6817><s%>, but none giveth answer <S%H6030><s%>, Because <S%H6440><s%> of the pride <S%H1347><s%> of evil men <S%H7451><s%>.
Surely God <S%H410><s%> will not hear <S%H8085><s%> an empty <S%H7723><s%> cry <S%H7706><s%>, Neither will the Almighty regard it <S%H7789><s%>.
How <S%H637><s%> much less when thou sayest <S%H559><s%> thou beholdest <S%H7789><s%> him not <S%H1779><s%>, The cause is before <S%H6440><s%> him <S%H2342><s%>, and thou waitest for him!
But now <S%H6485><s%>, because he hath not visited in his anger <S%H639><s%>, Neither doth he greatly <S%H3966><s%> regard <S%H3045><s%> arrogance <S%H6580><s%>;
Therefore doth Job <S%H347><s%> open <S%H6475><s%> his mouth <S%H6310><s%> in vanity <S%H1892><s%>; He multiplieth <S%H3527><s%> words <S%H4405><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%>.
